title: The Apple has fallen far from its tree
text: The Apple has fallen far from its tree.  I purchased a new MacBook Air. With its stores shutdown in Canada due to Covid I was expecting that Apple would compensate by upping its online and over-the-phone support.   My call and conversation with an Apple agent to help with some application migration problems from my old Air quickly disabused me of that expectation.  She could care less that Apple's online migration instructions didn't work and offered one suggestion: repurchase the apps instead of transferring them.  I ended up moving them with a thumb drive and re-registering them, which saved me about $315.00.

title: Excellent products
text: Excellent products. I have had iPhones, iPads, iPods, and MacBooks since 2005.  The quality of the products is 90% perfect. They would easily last 10 years, but their planned obsolescence scheme depletes the quality over time, like: updates that diminish battery life, or cable sheathing that falls apart.  I understand the short-term business logic, but it makes me want to shop around for better-quality electronics. Make a quality product that gives long-term value to the customer, and I will buy Apple for life.

title: Apple insurance useless
text: I bought an iPhone 12 Pro Max and it was stolen. I paid for the theft insurance and all that in full. The phone is gone and I had to deal with not getting a refund. The insurance is useless when it comes to theft.

title: Google was massively seed funded by the CIA, but Google got Apple to block my App Store review when I mentioned that and they also removed my previous edit where I didn‚Äôt write that.
text: As the owner of two iPhones and a MacBook Pro I‚Äôm extremely disappointed with Apple and their collusion against me with fellow members of the smartphone tech duopoly, Google. Below is the review of Google Maps Apple refused to post on the App Store, after they had previously posted it for months without an addition I made. When you submit a review it is not immediately posted. I have recently learned that it goes to the developer, who has an option to reply or ‚Äúreport a concern‚Äù. Google had previously deleted SIX out of SEVEN related Google reviews at around the same time that were TRUTHFUL, FACTUAL, HONEST REVIEWS of appalling, abusive, corrupt treatment I had suffered over a long period of time at the hands of English solicitors, police and companies. Yet they ask you to help others by writing your honest account of your experiences with the company or at the location. Google did this to hide the shocking pattern of abuse and horrific treatment that I had suffered from these English police and firms. It deleted so many reviews without explanation, warning or notifying me or giving me a way to contact them to question, challenge or appeal its extreme and damaging actions and even when I used my Google Account feedback to write to them, they never bothered to reply. This is the Chinese Communist style censorship ability introduced by the advent of the internet and related tech firms, many of whom were seed funded by the CIA, NSA and DARPA.  My first App Store review of Google Maps was a one star review but said nothing about their funding sources. Some weeks later I added the removal of my six reviews and Apple allowed that, although Google may have reported it. It was when I added that Google was seed funded by the CIA, the previous edit disappeared (which seems to happen when you edit), but my update failed to materialise. So they removed what they had previously passed, without posting my update. Why did Apple not leave the former edit in place if they didn‚Äôt want my update? I now realise that Google developers reported my update, so they removed six of my reviews on their own website, then had Apple remove my review which spoke of their deletions. Google, which is a product of the US military‚Äôs DARPA, is a very sinister company.   I tried reposting and then re-edited my post to remove the CIA reference, I posted and waited a few days, then I became frustrated and I used the review writing facility to speak to both Google developers and Apple staff. I said my updated review was blocked, my OK‚Äôd review removed, that attempts to repost, even repost without the update hadn‚Äôt been accepted. I said I would make a complaint. Strangely, the next day the post I had been waiting to see posted suddenly appeared, but the next day Apple responded to my complaint by removing that which they had decided to allow, never to post it again, even edited, despite many attempts.  I have been prevented from giving any review of my experience of Google Maps app at all, which as an iPhone user of the app I am supposed to have the right to do, like anyone else. And this is with no communication from Apple or Google, who are deliberately frustrating me and adding to abuse I have been suffering for long. Apple tell the app devs they won‚Äôt tell the reviewers the devs reported them, but I know Google did take advantage of my frustration and that Apple is colluding with Google against one of their own customers to do to me what notorious censors Google have already done to me many times. My review of Google Maps suppressed by Apple: ‚ÄúWhat I noticed while using the app was that when I logged out and used it, I started getting ads from a taxi operator. This tells me my personalised log-in data coupled with my location data over time is very valuable to Google, like gold. So they don‚Äôt bother with the ads when you‚Äôre logged in. But when I logged out, they felt they had to monetise me in some other way. The personal and location data compromise with Google is far too much for me to use this app long term. They really prefer you to be logged in when you use the app, but it‚Äôs not necessary. I also found they encouraged (or one could say ‚Äútricked‚Äù) me to set location to ‚ÄúAlways On‚Äù, rather than ‚ÄúWhile Using the App‚Äù using the reason that I would receive up to the minute traffic information. But the traffic info was perfectly OK even when location was only on ‚ÄúWhile Using the App‚Äù, so I think it is highly questionable of Google to encourage us to have location always on.  No way is this app as ‚Äúfree‚Äù as it appears."

text: When it works, it's great. When it doesn't, its terrible... I unfortunately rely heavily on my iphone for work (covid wfh has made it impossible not to rely on cell phones...) title: I was literally robbed by Apple, $1200 for a broken computer that can't be fixed
text: I was literally robbed by Apple. I know this won't stop most people from buying their products,  I'm just really really upset. I had a macbook that had stopped working. In February 2020 I brought it in with my parents. We were thinking of replacing it with a new computer, but we wanted to get it looked at first. The man at the genuis bar looked at our computer and recomended that we not buy a new computer, because our version was not sold anymore and was a really great model. He instead recomended we refurbish it. My parents agreed and we paid $1,200 to replace the keyboard, screen and battery that had water damage and we were told we had a warranty.  I returned a few weeks later to pick it up. Everything looked good, it was working fine. Then I took it home and within 2 weeks it stopped working. COVID happened and the store was moved so it took us like 4 months to come back. I made an appointment and came in. The genius man assured us we still had a warranty, that they will keep it and call us when they know the problem.  A few days a very rude lady called me to tell me there was no point fixing the computer because there was water damage all over the battery.  I swear on everything, I never EVER spilled anything on it after it was fixed. I try to tell this women and she cuts me off saying sorry but because since it waswater damage our waranty won't work plus our warranty was expired after 3 months. I tried to tell her the man said we did have a warranty and she said nope he must of got the dates wrong. I said I wanted to come get my computer and she was suprised I still wanted it? I don't usually leave reviews but I have never felt so robbed in my life. Like just thinking about apple makes my stomach sink.  I can't believe we paid $1,200 for nothing.

title: COMPLAINT: Most terrible phone with unsuitable support options
text: COMPLAINT: Most terrible phone with unsuitable support options Today I raised a number of issues culminating in 101375498511. Worth saying I have been a user and advocate for apple for 36 years since my LC at the age of 7 to today. This is the second time my iPhone XR's screen has failed.  The first occurrence was a massive inconvenience, having to go into store and wait for over a week or two for a repair. On first occurrence its moderately acceptable for a consumer to manage issues. On the second occurrence this time its not acceptable for a consumer to be inconvenienced considering the original price of the product.  At it is the two support options don't work for me: 1. In store repair - I have a disability, I am at greater risk during this pandemic, I cannot go into store because I don't have transport, I will also not conduct travel during the pandemic. Lastly and importantly I will likely be without the phone for personal and mostly business reasons. My business is struggling in the pandemic as it is. I cannot afford to be uncontactable for realistically a week 2. Mail in - Again importantly I will likely be without the phone for personal and mostly business reasons. My business is struggling in the pandemic as it is. I cannot afford to be uncontactable for realistically a week. I believe apple need to supply a solution to help people in this period. That means using the apple care plus track and supply a stop gap phone during repair. I have said that I would pay for this stop gap phone but that is not an option and there are NO other options than 1 or 2. That cannot be possible in a trillion$ market cap organisation? There must be pathways where apple TRULY support their customers and not just say so. That means not putting them at an extremely convenience for repeat faults. This screen fault has already consumed about 2 weeks the first time and now 1 day. The guys at the highest customer support tier claim there is nothing I can do, but there should be. Come on Apple we stand by you, stand by us with some method that works and offer paths to explore The most I was given was a feedback link with a character limit too small to explain my disappointment at apple.  This is the fastest way to loose customers.

title: Apple engineers are incompetent and customer service non-existent
text: Apple have hindered getting a resolution to problems making and receiving calls, which get cancelled or immediately dropped for no reason on my iphone11 pro.  The screen also goes black unexpectedly as I'm using the phone.  I followed all advice online with no success before contacting them.  I contacted Apple a month before the end of the warranty period and have jumped through numerous hoops since whilst they tried to decide if the issue was "environmental" (i.e. network), software or hardware.  Customer service is inconsistent and difficult to access (a senior advisor was assigned several times to my case, which shouldn't happen as they're supposed to stick with a single case once referred to them).  The phone has been used in multiple places with the same problems recurring, taken to store (who found nothing wrong), had multiple factory resets, even switched SIM cards and it's unequivocally the handset that is the problem.  The problem was finally passed to Apple's engineering department who claimed there was no problem despite numerous instances of cancelled phone calls during a test period.  Faced with my screenshots of the call history during their (non-)diagnostic test they eventually "recognised" it as an "emerging problem" but no solution has been offered in over 6 weeks.  Nearly 3 months have passed and despite my regular follow ups and complaints Apple have not resolved problems with the core function of a phone.  Their "support" is a joke (worse than useless because of the amount of my time they've wasted) and Apple's engineering department incompetent.  1 star is too much for a company who ignores evidence and treats customers like dirt.

title: If I could give a negative star review‚Ä¶
text: If I could give a negative star review on Apple, I 100% would. One of the worst and most unhelpful companies I have ever dealt with. I got my phone stolen 4 days ago and went through insurance to get a new phone and just now received it. NOW the new phone is telling me it needs 24 hours to verify that it is me AFTER I verified the codes through my email AND my credit card attached to my Apple ID. I called and the answer I was given to my issue was, "sorry but that is above our heads there is nothing we can do in the meantime you will just have to wait." LIKE REALLY?!? Oh yea, let me just wait for 5 days without a phone when I have school, work, and live across the country from my family. I've confirmed my information and there should have been no reason to not have access to my new phone. My next phone will without a doubt be Samsung. Getting rid of all apple products and it has never been more liberating. I highly suggest not supporting this company who offer no help whatsoever.

title: If I could give zero stars I would
text: If I could give zero stars I would. I had the worst customer service experience of my life last week at an apple store in littleton Colorado. It was the store in the aspen grove complex at Santa Fe and Mineral. With Covid regulations, you have to have an appointment to even walk in the store. Which is completely understandable. So my family and I made two appointments. I was looking to buy a new I pad or Laptop. My mom had just bought a new I phone 12. The first appointment was scheduled at 5, this one was for me to talk with a sells rep and get help to determine what product was the best for me. The second appointment was at 515. This was for my mother and my daughter. They needed help transferring the data from my moms old phone to her new one, erasing the phone, transferring the data from my daughters phone to her old one and getting her Apple Watch paired to the phone. When we walked in at 5 and told them about our appointments, they started off by telling us that we couldn't have two appointments. That every one gets one 15 min session. We tried to explain that we were there for two different things but they didn't care. After having to argue with them for 10 mins, they finally told my mother and daughter to go wait outside in the cold until their appointment. (Which was in 5 mins). I was then directed to my sells person. He asked me what I needed a new I pad or Laptop for. I explained the things I use the products for and started asking him questions about the differences between the I pad Air vs the Pro vs the different laptops. I was asking about the processors, the memory and such. The sales person told me they are all the same, when your just answering E-mail. He made me feel like a complete idiot and after asking a couple of question in less than 10 mins, He told me I would be better off just ordering something on line from home. I was ready to spend any amount of money I needed to, I was ready to get the best product with all the bells and whistles, but left empty handed and so upset Im looking online for other non-apple products. My mom and daughter were up next. They told the genius about their situation. They were told that would take more than the allowed 15 window they were given, after waiting almost 20 mins for their appointment. (BTW we noticed 6 or 7 other employees just standing around while they waited.) He then told them their question was basic stuff and they should be able to figure it out on their own at home. My mom wanted to buy a new case and screen protector. She was going to buy the apple I care for both phones. But was sent out the door, also feeling like an idiot. I know this is long, but I just can't believe the total disrespect and complete rudeness of this Apple store. If your planning on spending any money with apple or have a question or problem. You will be better off watching you tube videos and ordering on line.

title: Will not honour international warranty
text: Horrible! Apple Norway takes the advantage of using Resellers to service their products. The resellers are not trained in handling Apple products sold outside of Norway, and they have no intention of honouring international warranty whatsoever. You must call Apple beforehand so that they can inform them before showing up. I did, and Apple Norway would not take responsibility for the obvious design flaw. The staff were just laughing at my claims, and thought it all was just funny because they aren‚Äôt obliged to repair products sold outside Norway (due to strict domestic laws; reklamasjonsrett). They quoted me $1000 to change the screen due to overheating components in the screen assembly! I described the design flaw and that I knew what caused it and they wouldn‚Äôt listen even though I knew I was right... I was redirected to the ¬´Brand Manager¬ª who had the title as a brand damage control specialist. He pretended to know Norwegian, but it was obvious he worked in Cork, Ireland. He was not helpful at all and wouldn‚Äôt ask my questions. Apple Norway uses their market position to behave like they have no competitors. I have decided to quit buying Apple products, and that for a good reason. I decided not to repair the screen either so that my collegues and friends can see and feel how Apple Norway treats international customers.

title: Terrible customer service
text: Trying to get through to useful customer support virtually impossible. Had to wait for over 2 weeks for a response which was ill-informed and unhelpful. Ipad is very expensive. I don't think it is worth it. May be it is if nothing goes wrong with the device or your account otherwise don't expect service which matches the price tag.

title: Okay as long as it works
text: Okay as long as it works. But if you forget your password it's game over. If it's an iPhone or ipad then you need a computer with iTunes. This doesn't always work and sometimes brick the unit in the process because itunes is a bad piece of software that has been neglected. Furthermore if you forget the password on a mac you have to put it into recovery mode and go into terminal and type "forgotpassword" to get to the option which can help you. How could a normal customer do this? If you wipe the hdd to reinstall the OS you're in bad luck. You need an administrator account that doesn't exist anymore and you've bricked your computer. Congratulations.

text: I had many issues but never had a time to publish my review.  I did purchase New iPhone 12 Pro 20 days ago. Just recently had issue with phone dynamic/speaker. I had report this issue and booked appointment in apple store at Westfield Shopping Centre. After interview and clear investigation i been advised for repairing I left my phone for half day at that time I was without a phone. I pick up my phone And the next day I have the same issue with dynamic/speaker. I try to contact again with Apple and I been told I have to go again to the apple store to repair my phone again but I don't have a guarantee that after one week will be the same. Very poor apple service

title: Nothing to complain about.
text: Purchased a MacBook via Apple.com. Shipping was fast, took only 3 days and the computer arrived unharmed. I'm satisfied and I will continue to shop at Apple's website. Whenever I can afford it :)

title: Rejecting to repair handset, disappointing customer services at Westfireld Shopping Centre
text: Using apple product since 2010. I had many issues but never had a time to publish my review but not today... I did purchase New iPhone 12pro last year. Just recently had issue with phone dynamic/speaker. I had report this issue and booked appointment in apple store at Westfield Shopping Centre. After interview and clear investigation i been advised to pay ¬£259 for repairing (dust come through speaker/receiver and damaged my handset). Instead to offer some discount or get better solution by the adviser I come out disappointed as such kind of dust can damage your handset which is cost 1k. I did contact my insurer provider (Natwest Bank/platinum membership) and received new handset within 24h with just ¬£100 access fee. I am strongly recommending to ensure your devices through independent insurance providers to safe your money and keep product fresh and new.

title: Excellent products & service
text: Ordered replacement mac book pro case via free standard delivery 6.56pm. Delivered next morning before 8.30am. Amazing service & significantly cheaper than Amazon.  Love Apple products, aftercare always been great too.  From other reviews here, seems people only post when things go wrong, which is inevitable when selling products & service at such scale. If all satisfied Apple customers posted, star rating would be much higher.

title: Cheaters
text: Cheaters, cheaters¬†...I bought the iPhone 11 on the Apple website. After purchase I received an email receipt with purchase price and tax. A minute ago I received a fraud alert from my credit card bank. My credit card account recorded two transactions from Apple. The first transaction was for an iphone purchased at total price with tax. The second transaction¬†was additional sale tax (unauthorized¬†transaction). Because of this unauthorized¬†transaction¬†my¬†card was shut down. When I was picking¬†up my new device from the store I did not even hear "sorry" from an Apple specialist. She just said: "Are you taking it or not?" Everyone please be aware that the price which you see at the checkout is not a final price. Apple will charge your card without your¬†authorization for additional sale tax. Bravo Apple, bravo cheaters !

title: POOR QUALITY
text: Apple's supposed quality is one of the foundational pillars as to why consumers purchase their products. However, there is no excuse for a completely failed product after only 2 years of extremely light usage. I purchased a 13" MacBook Pro which I rarely ever used, but not Apple support claims it needs a $600 new logic board for it to function. INEXCUSABLE. I wish I could verify the amount of hours this laptop has operated before dying. There are laptops in the $100 range that outperform this product. I'm angry not simply because this product has failed, but because Apple has refused to stand by their product. I understand length of warranties and whatnot, but there is absolutely no credible reason for a logic board to fail in such a short amount of time other than Apple sold me a defective product, or at the very least a product with very poor quality.

title: New to the world of Apple
text: I am new to the Apple world.  I recently bought an Ipad Air 4th generation.  Lovely.  I have a large number of music files on a Windows PC which I wished to transfer to my Ipad, to have them physically present on the Ipad, not in the Cloud.  With an Android tablet it is an easy task, just connect the tablet and copy the folder with the music over. Not so easy with IOS.  I called the customer support line and had difficulty making the operator understand, she did not know how to do it.  So I asked for another operator, who similarly did not understand the question, nor was able to answer my query.   I finally managed to talk with someone else.  He eventually understood my request, but basically he did not know how to help me.  I I had been on the phone for 45 minutes, and three operators were unable to tell me how to make hard copies of music files held on a PC, to my Ipad. I finished the call and then went on to an Apple support page, where I found the answer, which is simply to connect the Ipad to the PC and select ‚Äòshare files‚Äô in Itunes.  It was so easy.  I copied my files to VLC and am now happy that I also have my files on my Ipad. However, I now have little confidence in Apple support, if they are unable to answer such a simple question.  Surely there must be other PC owners who have wanted to transfer files to an Ipad? May I add, that the three advisers, although not compentent were very polite.

title: I would give less than one star if possible..
text: I would give less than one star if it was possible. The worst customer service I have ever come across. McDonald's has better customer service. There was an unauthorized purchase on my account by my 3 year old. And because I was FOUR days late on the 60 day return window I was told by the manager Niesha that there was absolutely nothing she could do. I was unable to find any contact info in the apple store or how to stop the subscription in the store. It was for a relaxation app and one year subscription. And was never used. I reminded Niesha, the manager that we are in the middle of a worldwide pandemic and I am dealing with many issues at the same time. You would think any business would have a little compassion for those sick & mothers stuck at home working full time & babysitting full time. I have not asked for a refund the entire 10 years I have used their products. So because of the crappy service over a $25 subscription, I will be returning two iphone X, iwatch, ipods, and the ipad that I own. I don't want anything associated with such an ignorant company in my house. You charge enough for these phones you would think you could have better customer service. text: The iPhone is great but returning things and shipping process in general are a bit problematic. For many brands it is acceptable, but for Apple, nope!

title: Mini Mac
text: I have wanted to switch to an Apple system for some time but finances prevented me from giving up my trusty Windows system computer. Well just recently I made my dream come true and bought the new Mini Mac. Why did I wait so long? It's a pleasure to use, supper fast. I have taken to it like a duck to water. I didn't get the apple screen, they seem very expensive compared to others. I went for a 4K Samsung screen which is clear enough for my needs and less then half the cost of the Apple screen. I have loaded my photo programs for editing photographs etc. and the mini mac races through any task thrown it's way. No more waiting time, no waiting at start up etc. Can't comment on customer service as everything has fitted into place without any problems. Not bad for a 70 year old. I can now see why my friends who have Apple systems would never go back to Windows.

title: I felt betrayed after being a loyal customer for so many years. Bad customer service.
text: As an owner of 7 Apple products, I am appalled at the customer service I have received today. It has made me rethink about Apple being my go-to company for technology products. It is the case in my household that an Apple purchase is often made without a second thought ‚Äì a new laptop? MacBook it is. Looking to buy a smartwatch? Apple Watch will do the job. Need headphones? AirPods are the best investment. Need computer peripherals? Apple Magic Keyboard and Mouse cannot be beaten.  Due to this decision-making process, I am upset today and challenging my thoughts; despite having enjoyed excellent customer support throughout the previous many years, it has left a bitter taste today. Having spent thousands of pounds on Apple products, my request today was for a value much smaller: I had forgotten to redeem the Apple Fitness+ 3 month free subscription when I bought my Apple watch. This can be put down to the COVID-19 pandemic and fitness not being a priority over the period. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay‚Äù, I thought, as the customer support will be able to help me, just as they always have. I was wrong. Having politely asked for an exception to the rule and have the offer on my account activated; I was rudely told that this is not possible. For a ¬£30 subscription, Apple has lost a client whose value is much higher to the company. It can be seen on my account that I am a loyal customer of Apple.  I‚Äôm not one to leave negative reviews for companies and try to see things from their perspective. I am also not disappointed about the loss of the ¬£30 subscription ‚Äì I‚Äôm disappointed that I had embedded trust into a company and felt like my trust was misplaced ‚Äì I have been let down. I feel betrayed for investing in Apple products only to be rejected without much explanation or offers provided. In contrast, other telecommunication companies offer discounts by the least.  Having portrayed my disappointment to the Apple advisor on the phone support, he dismissed my views without much thought. After telling him that I will be thinking twice before buying Apple products, he simply said ‚Äúwell, at least you know for the future how offer redemption works‚Äù.  I‚Äôm not sure I have quite grasped that yet, but I have a very clear idea of how Apple operates as a company. As a matter of principle, I will certainly not be purchasing any more Apple products in the future.

title: Apple batteries go fast! Expect you to pay storage! Expensive!
text: Apple, is expensive. It‚Äôs wrong that when you purchase a new phone which the price ranges from 500 upwards. They want you to pay for more memory. This is not right and is unfair. Because people can‚Äôt afford these phones yet take out contracts and are expected to pay for more storage. I like Apple because it is much easier than Androids. I am seriously thinking about changing my phone. Since, I have had these phones there has been nothing but trouble. For example, I had the iPhone 8 and had lots of trouble as time went on. I contacted Apple customer service who tried to charge you to have a look which ranges from 250-300 pounds not forgotten if they have to repair. They manage to do mine because of a error on the product. So, had to send in for a repair. And was easy enough to send. The only problem I found was that the link to say what they were doing was not helpful. After a few days I received a phone back was not my old one but apparently not a ‚Äònew one‚Äô or an ‚Äòused one‚Äô.  The reason was that my phone was stuck on the Apple logo and would not be removed.  I think it‚Äôs wrong as I have had androids phones and know people who have had them and they have had no trouble with regards to memory and batteries. For what the product costs Apple needs to improve the quality. Also, the storage says about on the device but there‚Äôs no way to remove it. Also, you should not have to pay for more memory when you buy a smartphone that costs a few hundred pounds. I expect it better than other phones.  I contacted the apple customer service again as this new phone keeps playing up since the download and told me to reset the phone and I asked whether it would delete anything and she said no but once came back on it appeared to have deleted. Another, thing also is iCloud backup as you cannot complete it without purchasing more storage as I‚Äôve tried many times to backup but won‚Äôt allow me.  I have 11.7 GB of 64GB used and yet it still appears to say the phone storage is full on my emails and settings and when I try to do backup.  I am seriously considering buying another phone because I‚Äôve had many iPhones and they are poor quality. I think it‚Äôs wrong a company can charge so much for a phone or product that battery goes quick and they expect you to pay for more memory and get fixed at their centre so you have to pay more money. Not everyone can afford to do so.

title: Poor customer service, and uninformed management.
text: I recently took my iphone and iMac into the Apple store for long standing issues. I'll start with my iphone, while working on my phone with a store employee and getting very involved in what we were doing a store supervisor told the person who was working with me that they had to break away from me and help someone else and a new person was going to take their place and we had to almost start all over again. I ask why that took place and I was told that Apple doesn't want employees working with one person too long so they keep moving employees around. This to me is a major inconvenience to the customer, and this action demonstrates EXTREMELY  POOR customer service. We the customers deserve far better treatment than to be treaded off like an old broken piece of equipment. This practice is disturbing  and uncalled for and I would like to see this procedure changed. Remember we customers are your life's blood and your bottom line. I would love feed back...  Now my iMac, like my phone I have had a issue with my Mac for over a year, that seems to be unfixable. And after taking my Mac into the store, I was told that only software engineers could fix the issue on my Mac. Again while working on my Mac a supervisor told the employee to hurry and get done and move on. The issue was not solved and I was told that they would have someone call me to arrange to ship my Mac to a repair center, finally this morning I became tired of waiting and I called to find out what was taking so long. "BUT" while trying to talk to a support person my new phone started acting up and no one on the other end could hear me. I took my phone to the store and once again after working on my phone for a while the supervisor pulled the employee (who was doing a great job) and moved her and put someone new in her place and I had to explain to the new person what the issue was and what was going on, now I'm getting upset, and after working on my phone leaving me to complete the setup, I was told to once again call support about my Mac. They did say someone would call me this evening. When that person called I was told I couldn't mail my Mac to the repair center it had to be the store personal, so now I'm going bace to the store tomorrow with my Mac in hand and see what happens. Either fix my Mac or replace it... (And stop moving employees who are working with customers)...

title: I‚Äôm on my 4th iPhone
text: I‚Äôm on my 4th iPhone, second desk imac, 2 prior iPads, and most recently my 2nd iPad.  All I can say is that my first phone was the best and with each subsequent phone, the quality and ease of use has gone down.  My first iMac was the best computer ever.  This newer and much more expensive is as quirky as it gets.  I don‚Äôt know what to say about my new iPad except I hate it.  Screen moves around, keyboard is insensitive, sites (multiple) don‚Äôt load right and then close for no reason, flips back to prior site for no reason plus.  I‚Äôm back to using my 6 year old iPad.  Apple support is good but who wants to spend hours in the phone every month.  I just want something that is simple and reliable.  I‚Äôve been an apple user except at work for over 20 years but I think it‚Äôs time to give Android a chance.

title: Training Opportunity
text: Hi, I want to share my experience I had this week at the City Creek Center - Apple Store located in Salt Lake City, UT. A few weeks ago I had a bad accident involving my phone resulting in major cracks on the front and back of the phone. I made a Genius Bar appointment at my local Apple store to see if there was any way of repairing the phone. The employee helping me told me that the phone could not be repaired, but that I could get some trade-in value for $50. I was surprised by this and asked the employee if he could double-check with a manager just to make sure I could get a trade-in value. He confirmed and told me I had 14 days to bring the phone back to the store to receive the trade-in value (I would have done the trade-in same-day, but I needed to do backup on my newly purchased phone).  Yesterday, I returned to the same Apple store to bring my phone in. I told the employee about my previous conversation with the other employee, and he informed me that my phone would NOT qualify for trade-in. Disappointed, I asked him if he could double-check with someone. He came back and confirmed that I would not be able to get any trade-in value for my old phone.  Now, $50 really isn't a big deal. I wasn't expected to get any trade-in value in the first place. But, I drove all the way to my nearest Apple store during a pandemic and even requested time off from work to accommodate my appointment with an Apple specialist. If the phone wasn't worth anything, I wouldn't have bothered coming in. This experience didn't make me feel valued as a customer and it makes me question the way Apple employees are being trained. Why would I have received two VERY different answers about my phone's trade-in value? I'm not sure. I think this is a great opportunity for Apple to better train their employees.

title: I absolutely love apple

title: I dont mean to be a karen buuuuttt.....
text: I dont mean to be a karen buuuuttt..... I get that they are trying to do the best during the pandemic but I have a few issues with people telling me what I can and cannot have or telling me 1 person per household when clearly they can see the person that your with has medical issues like a cane and clearly cant walk very well... So here is my issue, I get that shops have a guideline to follow but telling someone that they cant go in to assist their mother (who clearly has medical problems) immediately and after me telling them "so your basically saying I can't assist someone who clearly cant walk properly...and what if she falls who is going to be the one to help her up? you guys cant touch her soooo..." which made them look childish for stopping me in the first place.... so after them making the -acception- I was then forced to change my mask to a medical grade mask that I cannot breath in due to my own medical problems (I have asthma as well as low deep breathing due to anxiety causing thick masks to make me faint... Kinda like shoving your face into a pillow and trying to breath... I have difficulty breathing as it is) so after me stunned and looking at them for a good 5 seconds and asking them again what they had said to me "we have to comply to store guidelines that were given to make sure everyone is wearing a medical grade mask" still dumb founded because now I am being told that my mask that helps me breath, that I have worn even before this pandemic and my doctor telling me avoid medical grade (since the last time I wore one was when I was 5 and I ended up fainting in the doctors office because I couldn't breath -complained about them then-) so now I kind of had an issue. So in order for me to be in the APPLE STORE I have to wear a mask that a) feels like a pillow on my face b) causes me to faint & c) gets to hot in them which caused me to cough and freak quite a few people. So now being told I couldn't help my mother who cant walk and not able to wear my mask because it wasnt medical grade... OKAY so my mask is a garter mask with ear peices on it. Its a light fabric for those who run, bike or do alot of activities. I have 3 of them and never had any issues of going into stores until now. Which ticks me off. I do get that they are trying their best, but dont dictate which masks is the best. Mine covers literally the lower half of my head, light fabric and has unique weaving so my own spit cant even escape and doesnt over heat unlike the 3 layered medical grade. But what really gets me is that this shop isn't outside, it was in a mall... There was a total of 10 people waiting and the store was full... I dont take my mask off until I get back into my car. but of course, I had no choice in order to assist my crippled mother I had to risk not only my health (if anyone is a carrier) or someone elses (if I was a carrier) which is reckless to say the least and defeats the purpose of trying to keep yourselves safe. That was a poor decision forcing someone to change their masks because of APPLES guidelines for their stores. I could see if it was someone who WASN'T wearing a mask but for someone who was wearing a covering over their face and thats beyond ridiculous. So after exposing the bottom half of my face and putting on the damn mask we get in and I was already getting dizzy and trying to steady my breathing which was getting harder to breath in. The poor guy was watching me as he was doing a diagnostic on my mothers cell phone and asked if I was going to be okay... and I answered "apple needs to change that policy of these masks. I am trying to keep myself coherent yet everything is going black" the guy also agreed that the policy on dictating on which mask is the best and forcing people to change their masks in public does defeat the purpose of wearing a mask in the first place... after a good 10 mins I booked it out of the store and immediately switched back to my mask where I could breath properly. Its a good thing I dont own an apple product (yet) and if anyone is planning on going to the stores, if you have medical issues preventing you from wearing the medical grades you might as well wait till the pandemic is over, send it through mail or if they change the guidelines about masks. At this point its not worth your health and having to risk yourself on having to change your masks specially if you have conditions (low immune disorders, asthma...etc). Sorry for typing so much, but it really does grind my gears about being told what mask I can wear in a store. Im at least wearing a covering that is comfortable for me... If I do end up in the hospital because of this stupid move on which masks I can ONLY wear in the store and forcing me to change it right there I put the blame on APPLE not the people who are force to follow APPLE's guidelines. Putting me and possible others at risk is negligent because of what type of mask you wear when you go in the store.

title: Oh how the mighty have fallen....
text: I‚Äôve used Apple products for over 15 years now, and have always been pleased with both the hardware and the support I have received...until now.  Having chosen to repair my iPad through Apple‚Äôs online service, I waited ca 10 days to receive the packaging in which to send away my device. I believe a good deal of this delay was caused by the chosen carrier (UPS) but since my contract is with Apple, and they didn‚Äôt provide any alternative options, I am holding them indirectly responsible for this delay.  I am also holding them responsible for sending the wrong packaging, that for an Apple Watch, and not an iPad, which was of course not fit for purpose. Despite my attempts to shorten the process from here on out by using the device‚Äôs original packaging plus the delivery labels I had received, I was advised that I had to restart the process (presumably to reset the clock on the repair) and waited an additional 3 days for the correct packaging to arrive. I packed away my iPad, sent off via courier the same day. I was advised that my device had been received the following day, and actually received a replacement refurbished product the the day after that, ie today. It seemed things were starting to look up....that is until it became clear that the replacement device, which initially powered up, is unable to hold it‚Äôs charge. Another 30 minutes on the phone to Apple‚Äôs support centre (having wasted 10 minutes with one employee who took various details and then transferred me to another department with no intro, causing me to have to repeat the security process) and the best they can do is to offer to ‚Äòpay for another repair/replacement on their own account‚Äô - how generous! I‚Äôve now completely lost faith in the whole process, and don‚Äôt see why I should have to waste even more of my time on this, time which is precious given I have a 7 day old baby at home, and a disgruntled 5 year old who has been without her iPad for approaching a month....first world problems I know, but within the context of having paid so much for this device and many others over the years, this is a truly awful level of customer service in my opinion. Furthermore, my attempts to get them to rectify this have been met with a request for me to wait till Friday until the seemingly very competent customer service representative I most recently dealt with returns to the office.....is this really the way one of the biggest customers in the world wants to treat a loyal customer? I suppose time will tell.... Update: While very pleasant, the customer service representative who asked me to wait until today to ‚Äòsee what more apple could do‚Äô was ultimately able to offer me nothing more than a phone call to waste some more of my time. Confused and contradictory messaging about whether they would seek to repair or replace my device with another device which would or would not be brand new wasn‚Äôt especially helpful, especially as it rather missed the point that I lacked confidence in this process as it already yielded delays and my receiving a non-functioning replacement. Ultimately, it seems Apple are either unwilling or unable to do any more than follow the standard repair process, irrespective of the fact that I‚Äôve already had to go through an elongated version of this process once only to receive a faulty replacement device, and that now 23 days on from my originally requesting a repair, I am still without a functioning device or a timeframe on when I can expect to receive one. Well done Apple, truly terrible service all round. Second Update: After yet more wasted time, this time via the chat function, I am still no nearer to resolution. On the contrary, there is now yet another delay to my receiving the packaging from UPS!

title: APPLE GOING NAZI ON PEOPLE WITH MEDICAL CONDITIONS
text: Little over a year ago since I got a new phone, I have been having problems with both, new phone and Mac.  I wanted to go in person to one of the stores but all of them were closed.  I spent several hours with technical support over the phone but they were unable to fix anything, they indicated the phone was defective so they offered to send me a new phone by mail which would not work for me as I would need help to activate/ transfer everything into the new one and it would still leave me with Mac issues. I decided to keep putting up with problems until stores would be opened again.  Stores reopened, but I just had to keep waiting as I‚Äôm unable to wear a mask.  After our State Governor held a round table with best experts ever and decided to lift masks requirements, I finally made an appointment with Genius Bar. Today I made it to my appointment bringing a face shield just in case, to be in compliance but to my surprise, face shield is no longer sufficient for Apple even at this juncture when requirement has finally been lifted in light of overwhelming true science based evidence that masks not only DO NOT WORK, but they‚Äôre actually HARMFUL to healthy individuals, let alone the ones with medical conditions. I was told I had to wear a mask also under the shield or just leave the store.  I explained I was wearing a shield precisely as an alternative since I can not wear a mask but the masked man was utterly insensitive and determined to make me leave. I asked them if they were aware that the Governor had finally removed the masks mandates and he stated they only abide by their corporate policy. Then I contacted corporate office and spent 53 minutes on the phone speaking with Sr Advisor only to confirm that indeed, Apple Corporate, in utterly departure from science, have obliviously resolved to DISCRIMINATE AGAINST PEOPLE WITH MEDICAL CONDITIONS.   I very much regret getting these items from these Nazis.  I‚Äôm now stuck with no service until I‚Äôm able to replace them both.  NO MORE APPLE FOR ME!!!

During checkout I was giving two choices for the order; mail devices to home by Tuesday, or Express Pickup @ local store (Apple North Star).  The item was listed as available today, so I chose Express Pickup. A logical person would assume express pickup would mean, the item would be available to the purchaser sometime today, since the order was placed at 12pm noon. So about 3:30 I head to the mall, assuming, the device would shortly be available. I stop by the Apple store with my purchase information and was greeted kindly by manager Andy. Andy stated processing usually takes a couple of hours. I educated Andy, the order was made at noon and it was 4pm at time of discussion, which is 2 x couple of hours. Andy called some corporate number and stated he was advised the order was showing still processing, but to wait on the pickup email and ask for him once I receive it and I would not have to wait in the entrance line again. Well, it's now the end of day two and the store closed already. I called Apple.com regarding my purchase,  and the young lady who answered the call asked what she could help with and I explained I was calling to check the status of my purchase. She advised me to hold on and the next thing I heard was the automated system asking me to enter the extension of the person I was trying to reach. I hung up and had to call back and spoke with a male customer service rep the second time, who stated they were reviewing my payment information and it should be cleared up in the morning. I inquired why would they they need to review my payment information and for what concerns? He stated, sometimes there could be slight errors that are reviewed and have to be cleared. I educated that I was in the local store the day before and if any information needed to be verified, then that would have been the best time to verify any concerns. The truth is, all of this has been a load of crock. These are operational issues and apple has demonstrated that after a year of closure, no one was intelligent enough to have a reopening plan in place. They have demonstrated a failure to timely process orders and provide standard customer service; which is the bare minimum below good customer service. We knew they lost the vision of the company when Steve Jobs died, but it appears they don't even have leadership capable of reestablishing a functional operation. Instead of fixing the problem, they chose to treat consumers as if we're all ignorant fools they can side track to cover their own failures. I've cancelled this order and truly understand now, how the android market has come this far into taking over a market once ruled by Apple.

title: Apple MacBook Air M1 Processor.
text: Apple MacBook Air M1 Processor. In January I purchased the above to replace my 12 year old MacBook Pro which was still working perfectly well but I wanted to improve the sound and it was quite heavy and large. I go all the way back to the SE30's with Apple and I've bought 100's of their computers having run a print business most of my life. From the outset I have pioneered postscript and the Apple interface with the print industry and whilst always greedy for more speed they have usually met my expectations, particularly the FX. I have also often sung the praises of Apple technical support who over the years have excelled themselves. It therefore saddens me to report how disappointed I am in the Macbook Air M1 processor. I stress the M1 processor as both my children have Macbook Airs and are very happy. I'm retired now so my demands of a computer are much less. I gave my Macbook Pro to my grandson on receipt of the new  MacBook Air M1. My main interest is football & travel and I'm signed up to Sky, BT, Amazon etc to watch all the games particularly whilst traveling. I was therefore most disappointed to note Sky Go didn't work whilst it did on my  Macbook Pro! I also have a problem at my partners home where the speed of my Macbook Air is only 25% of that of my partners 7 year old Macbook Air again not an issue with my Macbook Pro. After numerous conversations with BT & Sky Go making no progress whatsoever, I and my partner made one last attempt last night. I was finally put through to senior technical support and thought at last. He said he had reviewed the history of my issues and without checking anything whatsoever claimed to have identified the issue, much to my relief, it was in fact my expectations of a new computer as in the first instance there are often issues interfacing with third party Apps etc. Well I was fuming and let him know. I finally requested the opportunity to complain at a higher level, he said it had got to as high as it can and the next step would be to complete a complaints procedure which he would forward following our conversation. I'm still waiting!!! Whilst my expectations of progress can at times exceed reality helped I would say by Apples copy writing, I did not expect to go backwards who ever is responsible! I'm not that heartless to request my old computer back from my grandson so I have to watch the game on my Iphone!!!!! Very disappointed in you Apple and the volume / sound wasn't that much greater either! Could do much better.

title: I just find it really ridiculous that‚Ä¶
text: I just find it really ridiculous that it‚Äôs as difficult as it is to get into your Apple ID if you e forgotten the password. One should be able to answer a couple of security questions or something to be able to recover their own account instead I‚Äôve been on the phone with Apple employees for the last 3 hrs. Getting access to your own information with them is like trying to break out of prison. FIX IT JESUS!

title: I purchased a brand new iPhone in 2020
text: I purchased a brand new iPhone in 2020.  It had a green dot in any photos taken in bright lighting since it was sent to me.  I expected much MORE from iPhone and Apple.  Upon recently noticing an issue with my screen display (my phone doesn't have a cracked screen or hasn't been severely dropped), I decided to call for warranty replacement.  Since then, my opinion as a consumer of Apple has drastically changed.  They do every thing they can to avoid replacing the phone and make you do "trial and error" with no regards to how time consuming it is for the consumer, or how many phone screen covers you have to replace.  Then the worst was after I went in for the first "repair" when I really was asking for it to be "replaced," and they had me wait 1.5 hours for the repair and then said the "phone was fixed."  After this the phone actually has MORE issues.  Including a serious issue of me not being able to hear the person speaking during inbound calls. I now have to take all my phone calls on speaker phone.  This is AFTER having the Apple Store give it back and say "it was fixed" and it not being "replaced" as I had asked.  The entire reason I was asking for replacement was to avoid these types of time consuming headaches.  APPLE has no respect for the consumer.   Today while calling to address that the phone was given back with MORE ISSUES than I brought it in with...I was hung up on by a supervisor after 30 MINUTES of TROUBLE SHOOTING because she didn't want to help me book and appointment and hung up on me when I asked her to hold for 1 minute as I own a business and a client was calling me on the business line.  She hung up an although had call back info, did not call back! So then I have to call Apple and start from the beginning.  I even explained all this to them.  I WAS HUNG UP ON AGAIN by Tia the "supervisor," after doing about 40 MINUTES of phone support with her.  It seemed that she was making me go though UNECESSARY TROUBLESHOOTING when all I have been asking is simply to have my phone replaced through WARRANTY.  I  have experienced an issue with the phone that is eligible under the warranty for replacement and simply was asking for the phone to be REPLACED, not REPAIRED.  This is the THIRD time I had to call Apple support and the SECOND TIME I will be having to go back to the Apple Store in a week.  I will do my best to never buy an Apple product again after going through such unprofessional support, and having so much time wasted.  I was hung up on intentionally!

AVOID AVOID AVOID

title: Sent me a defective phone and it has been 8 days of hell
text: Recap: My 8 day ordeal with Apple 2/21/21-Order new Iphone 12 pro max  from Apple with financing and trade in program by ATT as offered on their website 2/25/21-Recieve iPhone and immediately try to transfer data from old phone to new phone. New phone freezes up and old phone is immediately deactivated. Spend hours online trying to see how to fix the freeze-try all the suggestions, nothing works 2/26/21 1-800-692-7753 spend hours on the phone all day with Apple support forcing me to try all the same tricks over again to get the phone to work. NOTHING works, finally they agree to let me send it back but say they have to cancel the old order to do that. (I assume that means the financing that trade in as well) She refunds what I had paid and tried to order me a new phone only to tell me that ATT will not allow men to place another order for 24 hours and there is nothing she can do about that. I explain I have no phone that works at this point and was using a borrowed phone. I explain I cannot call for police or fire that it puts me at risk.She is very sorry there is nothing she can do it is all ATT at this point. At first they wanted to get my phone in for servicing instead of giving me a new phone, I insisted on a new phone. I was instructed to put the new SIM card from the defective phone in my old deactivated phone so I could have a phone. I did that.  3/1/21-Call ATT, finally they give me a sales rep to tell me they are sorry but they can do nothing. Wait for 24 hours.  March 2, 48 hours later I sill can‚Äôt place order online because ATT still has a hold on being able to order a new phone. Now Apple says ATT requires up to 72 hours to reactivate a phone after one is cancelled.  March 3, 72 hours later I couldn‚Äôt order on Apple or ATT, old iPhone 100% dead now and can‚Äôt complete the verification code required by ATT sent to my messages because phone is dead. Can‚Äôt call anyone either. No chat function on Apple, found a chat function on ATT Spent over an hour being told my only option was to come into the store. I explained I cannot do that. They said I could call customer service and I explained I cannot do that because I have no other phone and my phone is dead. They do not serve us with landlines out here and my iPhone is my only communication device. They said they couldn‚Äôt help me. They said to try back tomorrow and see if someone there can help me.  I can‚Äôt order a phone online unless I can verify my old number and phone through text they send but I can‚Äôt do that because my phone is dead. I can‚Äôt call to order on the phone and I can‚Äôt go into the store.  March 4-8 days after receiving my new defective Iphone Fedx Tracking shows old phone returned. ATT- 30 minutes to tell me until Apple removes the installment plan from my account they can‚Äôt finance it.  Apple After being forced to go support I am rerouted to Sales Comes back with needing to ask more questions to tell sales. Wanting to know if this is a new phone return  Finally sales- shows the phone returned but said their process takes at least a couple of days to notify ATT-He could not do anything to speed that up but his goal was to make me happy. He was so sorry but could do NOTHING to help me. I am on my 8th day of trying to buy a new iPhone and being told it will take at least 2 days to a week more from Apple's side and who knows how much more time from ATT. Are they trying to run me away. I have been long time customer of both but this experience has been the most bizarre and  soul crushing as I have ever experienced. When you send a defective phone another one should be sent overnight and the paperwork to switch financing should take place behind the scenes. All of this time and heartache, I still don't have a phone. I am aghast. They deserve a -a million stars for this.

title: iPhone XS stopped working, only solution was "Buy a new phone"
text: I've had my iPhone XS, which I paid full price for ($1000+) for 2 years. Out of nowhere, it stopped turning on (flickering on and off at the Apple logo) and later got stuck in recovery mode with error 4013. I scheduled a phone appointment, who only scheduled an appointment at Best Buy for me. At Best Buy, they told me my only option was to replace the phone for $550. They couldn't identify the issue, only saying it *might* be a problem with the board. I scheduled another appointment at the Stanford Apple Store where I was again told my only option was to replace the iPhone XS for out-of-warranty price of $550 ($50 less than the NEW iPhone 11).  I was given mixed answers every time about the possible issue (maybe a problem with the lightning port, maybe a problem with the logic board, maybe a problem with the software). I was told to "yes, go to a 3rd party person to fix it... actually no, don't go to a 3rd party person to fix it". I was told that I could then get it replaced for a price of $279, and then they turned around and told me "whoops, we looked at the wrong thing, that can only be if there's a display issue, it's actually still $550, or you can buy a new phone". My phone didn't even turn on, which is a worse issue than the display, yet I couldn't even get it replaced for that price. After wasting hours researching fixes, talking to customer service on the phone, & driving 2 hours, nothing was done to ensure this wouldn't happen again or to comp me for an issue on APPLE'S part. I was even told to "invest" in an iPhone 12...what kind of return on investment did I get on my iPhone XS?! Obviously this is just planned obsolescence. I'm at the point where I am using my old iPhone 6s because it lasted me way longer; their products are just getting worse and worse.

text: I am a PhD Computer Science student and I own an internet healing meditation business. I have been a lover of Apple products since 2011. In fact, I taught undergraduate courses on usability at the Technical University of Nova Scotia, and extolled Apple. However, I have discovered that the company is no longer working well. I purchased a new Macbook Air on December 29, 2020. I was lied to by the sales person. I was lied to by people in Post Sales Billing when I tried to sort out the problems. I spent hours on hold and in trying to sort out the numerous problems with this purchase. In total, I have spent approximately 25 hours in resolving the numerous problems and issues with this purchase. This has been an inconceivable loss of my valuable time, and I will seriously think twice and even three times before purchasing another Apple computer. Be aware that the company is not working well, and has at least for me, offered a bitterly poor customer experience.

title: Poor customer service, beautiful expensive machines, that will break easily and cost a fortune to fix.
text: Avoid buying Apple products. Unless you are happy paying a premium price, for something that will break just as easily as everything else. Expect completely uninterested and unhelpful customer service. If I pay 4 times as much for an apple product I would expect a better quality product and better customer care.   From now on I will avoid Apple. I bought a macbook pro from Apple.com in 2018. In Autumn 2020, I had a problem one morning where it wouldn't turn on. There was nothing to show anything had gone wrong. I take very good care of it. It just wouldn't turn on, or acknowledge the charger was plugged in. So I tried my housemates laptop with the same charger. Unknowingly blowing 2 laptops logic board. All apple products and Apple chargers.   After hours talking to apple support about my options and visiting 2 different apple stores (which takes ages and is a total show where you are made to feel like a highly valued, yet, absolute idiot) I paid ‚Ç¨500 for each laptop for the new logic boards. A total of ‚Ç¨1000.  It seems absurd that a top spec laptop can be so easily ruined by a power surge when any other cheaper lower spec laptop can have the ability to stop such a thing ruining the most expensive part of a laptop. On top of that I had to spend another ‚Ç¨90 for a charger, and on top of that another ‚Ç¨20 for the chord, that is only 1m long, so I cant even charge my laptop at the table. unless I want to spend another ‚Ç¨30 on a longer one. At some point you just get fed up giving one of the richest greediest companies in the world more money.  If you think your paying more money for a better quality product and better customer service, think again. Its a big show, and very trendy and you may look good in Starbucks but unfortunately I think apple are one of the biggest scams out there.

title: Can Apple can be trusted?
text: Can Apple can be trusted? Since they can pull apps a customer has knowingly and willingly added to their phone whenever they please and change notifications, I am concerned about doing any updates to my phone. What are they doing in the background to the functionality I want on my purchased phone? I recognize the need for security fixes, but what else are they doing in the background? It‚Äôs not like Apple doesn‚Äôt have previous shenanigans going against them already.  Sure wish there was something other than Apple and android phone operating systems. I have yet to do the most recent update to my phone or iPad based on this concern. I just don‚Äôt know if I can trust them. Ticks me off.

title: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
text: I had an issue with my Mac book so I took it into the Genius Bar to be 'fixed' the genius staff took the MacBook out the back and brought it back instantly without it being a part and said there was no issues inside despite the Mac system saying there was. I was told it was a battery issue so I was given a new charger. A month or two later I took it in again and was given another new charger and no explanation as to why the Macs batter wasn't detected and wouldn't work without it being plugged in 24/7. I then took it in a third time and this member of staff took the Mac out the back and brought it back to show me the insides. The battery was leaking and had completely corroded whole board inside. (This could have been prevented if the first person I spoke to had done this to start with.  I was then told it would be around ¬£1,500 for the repair that it needed and I was best of just buying a new MacBook which is not what I wanted to do. I then requested to escalate this as it was an issue that could have been resolved if the staff had done what they needed to do the first time and actually looked into the Mac itself.  I received an apology by the manager who told me I would be better off buying a new Mac than getting the repair. I wanted to take this further so the manger offered me a discount on a MacBook. This was agreed that the laptop would be ¬£1,399.20 with a 24 month contract and a 14.9% interest rate. I agreed to this and was accepted through the Barclays partner finance app that the manager went through with me. However their systems weren't allowing anything to go through Barclays so I was sat waiting around for 2hours to be asked to come back the next day.  I went back the next day and the system was down still so I had to sit about for another 2 hours. At this point the manager offered me a case for the laptop free of charge. I sat for another hour with still no progress so I requested that it be stopped as I no longer wanted the Mac due to the wait. The manager then offered me another deal in which the interest rate would be dropped. I was told that the Mac would be ¬£1399.20 and there would be no interest. I agreed to this and agreed to wait a bit longer. The manager then came over and explained that it had finally went through however it would show as a 24 month contract but it would be around a 20 month contract instead as they would be taking care of the interest. He explained that I would be paying ¬£67.16 a month until the ¬£1399.20 was paid. This was what I had agreed to.  With that I received my receipt which stated the price would be ¬£1399.20 and I received my paper work from Barclays parter finance which has a total balance of ¬£1399.20 to repay and absolutely no mention of interest.  Skip forward to now. The full ¬£1399.20 has been repaid as well as more and they are charging me interest.  Spoke to Barclays and because it is an apple mistake they can't do anything about it as they didn't receive anything from apple to state interest won't be charged.  With this being an in store issue it is in store who need to resolve this however due to covid restrictions the store is closed. I tried to call the store numerous times and got no answer so rang the customer service line.  Spoke to a lady who explained there was nothing they can do as it was an in store issue but with me not being able to get in any form of contact with the store she agreed to escalate the case as I requested.  Spoke to a second agent who advised that he can see what he can do, took all the information etc to then say that apple have no procedures in place to deal with in store issues due to the COVID restrictions so I would need to wait until 'soon' at a financial expense to me until the store reopens and I can deal with this in store. I advised that the complaints get closed within a certain time frame so I wouldn't be able to escalate this again in which he advised I have a month. If the store is not open within a month I have lost out on ¬£250-¬£300+ which I should not be paying. This agent refused to accept this. I requested to go through to customer relations and was refused multiple times to then be given abuse off the agent, being spoke over and told "you are in complete denial you can not speak to customer relations" and then hung up on. I will be seeking legal advise, passing this onto the ombudsman and taking it to small claims court. Every time I get any apple products i always end up being miss sold, lied to and left to deal with it by myself with no help from customer service. They let me leave the store with a battery that was leaking due to water damage on the Mac and slowly corroding the inside of the Mac which could have caused an injury or anything as it was having to be plugged in to be used then I'm being told I need to pay an extra ¬£250-¬£300+ due to their mistake.

title: Apple and UPS
text: Ordered an IMAC on 01/02/21 - it is now 16/02 and no sign of the product. It has allegedly been at my local UPS hub for a week and UPS have been handling the product for 12 days - Apple said it would be delivered on the 10/02 - UPS said first 05/02, then 09/02, the 10/02 and then nothing... I have spent hours chasing this including three calls to Apple - with no update call back. Finally, today i got a customer service guy who did something - he phoned the hub (I gave him the direct number) where he was told there was a scan on 10/02 but now they cannot find the package - does this suggest stolen perhaps? So now I have to wait until Apple take up a missing package process with UPS - Apple guy has no idea how long this will take. If package is missing I am told IMAC will be re-sent - of course it will I have paid for it!!!   MAC is a customised spec so will take some time to build and will be re-sent by, yep you guessed it UPS. How can they be trusted to do this? It is like Groundhog Day. I expect significant financial compensation from Apple as they are not meeting their part of the contract ie to deliver to me by a set date, whilst sitting on my cash. Apple, dump UPS they have a worse rating than you on Trust Pilot - look at the comment they are totally incompetent. It will be interesting to see if anyone replies to this or is it just more wasted time.

title: Is this another crafty trick by Apple
text: Is this another crafty trick by Apple?  Bought a new Iphone SE a month ago and now I find it won't charge. It did not come with a charger so I bought two leads and an adapter which worked fine and now neither leads will charge the phone. I should have listened to advice and bought Samsung. Forced to buy a Lightening Lead and it works so this is true. Apple want to force you to pay more for a lead. I got one "onn" - 36inch for ¬£8 - so don't be fooled into paying more for an Apple lead It appears I was right it is another Apple con trick read below: iOS 12.4 Charging Stopped Working Thought this would help others out there. Are you using a non-Apple charging cable? Has your iPhone or iPad stopped charging after installing iOS 12.4? I recently installed iOS 12.4 and it caused my non-Apple charging cable to stop working on my iPhone 5s and my iPad mini 4. The Lightning cable that is used to charge iPhones and iPads has a chip inside it to authenticate the cable meets certain Apple design criteria and non-Apple Lightning charging cables have been known to stop working after an iOS software update, even those that have the chip and have been certified by Apple.

title: Five Star Service
text: Recently, I forgot my password and after so many attempts unfortunately my was disabled and shut down completely.  I did not have a phone for two days. Yes, two days!! Can you imagine that!!! Thank God I did have my watch so therefore, I did not miss a call or text message, but of course it was other apps that required access of my iPhone. I encourage investing in the Apple Watch . Long story short I ll like to give a special thanks to a few techs that helped me along the way. Justin, Jessica and Avi thank you so much for professionalism, time and patience.  I appreciate you all for taking the time out to get me back up and running.  Greatly appreciated!!

title: Recently my iPhone froze for reason‚Ä¶
text: Recently my iPhone froze for reason unknown.  I would press the start button for good long time but nothing changed.  I am not a tech savvy person so naturally I brought the phone to a professional who told me they could not do anything but for me to wait for the battery to wear itself out.  This took days.  Anyone who has been using smartphone for a longest time can testify how the device has become an integral part in someone's life, how we have become dependent on one for assistance.  So the solution was not helpful and my iPhone was one of the latest models.  Recently, my Apple TV is informing that it no longer supports YouTube and I need to purchase newer model.  My Apple TV is still in perfect condition but somehow I have to fork out AUD300 to get a new model.  This comes from a company that prides itself with updates (probably the reason why my iPhone freezed in the first place) but could not update my current Apple TV model... I think Apple no longer reflects what the late Steve Jobs envisioned for the users - to empower them and the cultivation of creativity freedom.   Nowadays, using Apple products feels like in a concentration camp - all controlled and dictated by a very draconian approach from Apple.  This company is an expert in disillusionment and aim to manipulate their users with their fancy marketing ploys.  I humbly urge people to think carefully before they purchase another Apple product.  It is akin to buying a hefty priced ticket to be locked up in a digital prison.

title: She blatantly lied about sending me an email to repair faulty AirPods and closed my case instead
text: The customer service woman I spoke to yesterday was rude and clearly couldn‚Äôt be bothered to deal with my daughters faulty air pod even though that‚Äôs her job. As it stands my daughter is stuck with faulty AirPods that are less than a year old and this would be the second repair. Absolute rubbish product would not buy again.  She tried to fob us off from the get go telling my daughter to do a reboot and install the latest update on her phone and ring back if still an issue even though we told her this problem has been ongoing prior to the new update being available.   She claimed I would receive an email with an authorisation hold on my card for replacement AirPods. I didn‚Äôt get this email instead I received a thanks for contacting email and a CASE CLOSED notification. What annoys me is I double checked my email addressed and asked her to confirm that she would send this email which she did. Clearly she blatantly lied which I don‚Äôt appreciate nor do I appreciate my time being wasted like that.  She spoke ridiculously fast and didn‚Äôt make any sense.  It sounded like I got through to a call centre in India. I asked her to slow down and speak clearly but she continued to speak fast. Infact, it just got her back up but I genuinely couldn‚Äôt understand what she was saying. Her grasp of English was very poor because what she was saying didn‚Äôt make sense and she spoke fast to disguise that.   There was something untrustworthy in the way she was speaking and the way she was trying to fob us off. We did ring on a Friday afternoon so maybe she was looking for an early finished and couldn‚Äôt be bothered. She had no qualms in blatantly lying to a customer though which is unprofessional to say the least. She shouldn‚Äôt be working in customer care. I can‚Äôt believe a big company like apple don‚Äôt vet their staff better and have better standard of customer care.  There should be some sort of feedback or customer satisfaction follow up afterwards so we can report these things.
